info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN APPOMATTOX AND SOUTHEASTERN CAMPBELL COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hat Creek, or near Brookneal, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Spring Mills... Mike... and Hat Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
